duties_responsibilities.duty: Carrying out patient care responsibilities with emphasis on decision-making related to the steps in the nursing process to include assessment, diagnosis, identification of expected outcomes, planning, implementation and evaluation.
Collecting, assessing and documenting patient healthcare data.
Involving patient/family and Interdisciplinary team to identify a plan of care and outcomes that are realistic and measurable.
Prioritizing care based upon data collected.
Documenting assessment and reassessment in medical records.
Implementing interventions in the coordination of patient care in a safe, timely and appropriate manner and applies escalation process.
Considering needs and behaviors of specific patient age groups and cultural groups in all patient care activities.
Educating the patient/family regarding health status and established plan of care.
Determining learning needs of the patient/family.
Evaluating the patient's progress towards expected outcomes.
Participating in and contributing to in unit activities to provide patient care in a healing, humane and caring environment.
Adhering to patient care and nursing standards in care delivery, and uses clinical practice guidelines (CPG).

education_certification.credential: Current Registered Professional Nurse in New York, Bachelors degree in Nursing preferred, Basic Life Support Certification through the American Heart Association, Fluent written and spoken English language skills.
